p: Despite the relatively few articles reporting risk assessment models (n = 19) collected for this review, it was observed that, in developed FMD free countries, FMD risk assessment modelling was performed, with the aim to estimate the risk of introduction of FMDV via several pathways including importation of animals or animal products [ 101â€“ 104]. Irrespective of the differences between the two approaches (quantitative versus qualitative), the decision-makers gained a thorough understanding of the FMD risk through risk assessment which resulted in sensible and realistic recommendations. If implemented, these recommendations can lead to a sustainable strengthening of capacities to prevent, control and even to eradicate FMD [ 18, 87, 105].
